Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 9th overall pick, by Wisconsin in 1980...
Traded from Wisconsin to Longport on 3/2/1980 (Going to LP: 3B S. Coleman, 2B R. Rochon, CF E. Godines, 1B A. Durso. Going to WIS: CF S. Stumpf, P J. Lavergne)...
Had first career hit (homerun) on 4/3/1983, off Dean Vinson (DIA)...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against West Texas on 5/9/1983...
Drove in 6 runs against Boston (UBA) on 7/13/1984...
Hit 3 homeruns against Gashouse, driving in 7 runs on 7/21/1986...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1986, hitting .522 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Manchester on 7/23/1987...
Injured on 8/27/1987 with a Strained Hamstring Muscle, out for one week...
Drove in 6 runs against Columbus on 5/16/1988...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1988, hitting .364 with 3 HR, 15 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Wisconsin on 4/12/1989...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
